chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 456 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at a future hearing.
07/13/2016  RESTITUTION WAS DETERMINED AT $60,250.00 FOR AUTOSCRAP RECYCLERS. The Court orders money seized and any assets that were liquidated to be applied towards the restitution. Funds to be dispersed to the District Attorney's office and they will notify the Dept of Corrections of any payments made to victim.   Court ordered restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
No possession of any body armour, firearms or any weapon.

No Contact with Dawn K., her family or her residence. No Contact with Auto Scrap Recyclers. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended. Comply with any other term deemed appropriate by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Notice of Appeal, filed by Attorney Pinix.

Order Denying Postconviction Motion for a New Jury Trial (Ineffectiveness of Trial and Appellate Counsel).
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 05/25/22.

Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody (by zoom from Wisconsin Secure Program Facility) , with attorney Matthew Steven Pinix.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Victim did appear by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Court to Address:  Defense Postconviction Motion for a New Trial (Ineffectiveness of both trial counsel and prior appellate counsel).

Atty. Pinix presented arguments to the court.
State presented arguments to the court.
Responses and replies presented.

Court finds the following:
The error was on the trial court, and that the error was harmless.
Defense trial counsel did try to get the evidence in.
The trial and appellate counsel were not defective.
There is no basis for a reasonable probability of a different outcome.
Therefore, Court denies the defense Postconviction Motion.
For all the reasons placed on the record.

Court signed the order denying the postconviction motion.

records.descr: Court of Appeals decision & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
Kevin M. Lipscomb, pro se, has filed a motion for reconsideration of this court's April 15, 2020 decision affirming the judgment convicting him of being a party to the crime of armed robbery.  This court is not persuaded that any basis for reconsideration has been shown.  Therefore,
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration is denied.

Letter from the Supreme Court of Wisconsin: The court having considered the motion of the defendant-appellant-petitioner, Kevin M. Lipscomb, to extend the time in which to file a statement in support of the petition filed in this matter by Attorney Steven Zaleski for review of the court of appeals' decision of April 15, 2020; IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. Defendant-appellant-petitioner, Kevin M. Lipscomb, shall have until June 18, 2020, to serve and file a statement in support of review. If the statement is not filed by that time, this matter will be disposed of based solely on the petition filed by Attorney Steven Zaleski.
  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 5/19/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.

Copy of Letter sent to the defendant from the Wisconsin Supreme Court stating:
On May 11, 2020, you appointed counsel filed a petition for review of the court of appeals decision dated April 15, 2020.  The petition states you will be responsible for providing reasons in support of the review.
Pursuant to WIS. STAT. 809.32(4) and 809.62 you are required to file a statement of reasons in support of the review within 30 days of the date of the decision of the court of appeals.  If we do not receive such a statement within the prescribed time, this matter will be submitted to the court for appropriate action.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody by video,  with attorney James E Goldmann.    Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to set restitution.  B.K. is sworn in and testifies.    Attorney Hulgaard conducts direct examination and Attorney Goldman conducts cross examination.  The witness  Attorney Hulgaard requests the money seized be applied towards restitution.  Attorney Goldmann requests the money seized be returned.  The Defendant is sworn in.  Attorney Goldman conducts direct examination of the witness.  Attorney Hulgaard conducts cross-examination of the witness.   The witness is excused.  The Court orders restitution in the amount of $60,250.00 payable to Autoscrap Recyclers.   Any assets that have been liquidated are to be applied towards restitution and Attorney Goldman to file a list with the Court.   The Court orders the seized money in Exhibit 115 is to be applied towards restitution Autoscrap Recyclers and to be dispersed to the State to be paid to the victim.   The State is to notify Department of Corrections of money dispersed to the victim. 25% of any prison funds be applied towards restitution.
From D.K. dated 7/3/16.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Parties review the PSI and discuss minor discrepancies in the report. The victim addresses the Court.    The Court schedules a restitution hearing for July 13, 2016 at 3:00 p.m.  The Defendant to appear by video.  The State to file its restitution claim with the parties by June 17, 2016.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

33 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT  456 days) (commencing forthwith).
  -  18 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  15 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with: Auto Scrap Recyclers.
*No contact with: Dawn K., her family or her residence.  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Any other term deemed appropriate by agent.
*No possession, of body armour, firearms or any weapon.

RESTITUTION:  (to be determined);

COURT COSTS:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Hulggard advises the Court that victim in the case may be requesting an adjournment of the sentencing date.  The parties schedule a backup sentencing date of 6/1 at 2:00 p.m.

Sentencing hearing at 04-20-2016 02:30 pm
Motion hearing at 04-18-2016 02:00 pm
Jurors request for exhibits dated 2/17/16 at 8:45 a.m. and 9:35 a.m.
Supplemental and amended decision and order signed by Judge Aprahamian on 2/17/16.

Attorney James E Goldmann in Court.  The Defendant is in custody and the Court waives his appearance.  Defendant Andria Noel in Court with Attorney Daniel Exner. Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Goldmann motions the Court for a mistrial.   The State objects to the motion.  The Court takes the motion under advisement.  The Case is recalled with the same appearances but neither defendant is present.  The Court addresses the viewing of the evidence by the trial.  Attorney Goldmann objects to Exhibit #126 being released to the jurors.  The State requests the exhibit be released to the jurors.  The Court will grant permission for Exhibit #126 to be released to the jurors.  Attorney Goldmann may review the exhibit.  The Court recalls the case.  The Court will allow admittance of the paper printout of exhibit #126.  The Court marks the exhibit as Court Exhibit #126 and it is provided to the jurors.

The Court recalls the case at 1:38 p.m.  Defendant Kevin Lipscomb in Court, in custody.  Attorney James E Goldmann in Court.  Defendant Andria Noel in Court with Attorney Daniel Exner. Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The jurors reached a verdict at 1:20 p.m.  The jurors enter the courtroom at 1:40 p.m.  Jurors find the Defendant Andria Noel not guilty.  Jurors find the Defendant Kevin Lipscomb guilty.   Attorney Goldmann requests the jurors be polled.  The Court polls the jurors. The State moves for judgment on the verdicts. The Court enters judgment on the verdicts for both Defendant.  The Court revokes bail and order a presentence investigation report be prepared and filed with the Court on 4/4/16.

Attorney Exner and Andria Noel are excused.

Attorney Goldmann advises the Court he plans to file a motion.  Attorney Goldmann is to file a motion by 3/11/16.  The response to be filed by 4/1/16.  The Court schedules the motion hearing for 4/18/16 at 2:00 p.m. for one hour.

The Court sets the matter for sentencing for April 20, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.
Jurors selected for case.
Exhibits requested by the jurors dated 2/16/16.
filed by Attorney Goldmann.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.   Defendant Andria Noel in court with Attorney Daniel Exner.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JURY TRIAL DAY 6.  The Court calls the case at 9:15 a.m. outside the presence of the jurors.  The Court marks Court Exhibit 5 and Court Exhibit 6.  The parties discuss and prepare jury instructions. The Court will take discovery issues presented by the parties.  The jurors enter the Courtroom at 10:15 a.m.  Witness Nicole HInton with the State Crime Lab is recalled and testifies by phone.  The witness testifies by direct examination by Attorney Goldmann.  The witness is excused.  Attorney Goldmann calls Joshua 
L. to testify.  The witness is sworn in and testified under direct examination by  Attorney Goldman.  Attorney Goldman moves for admission of exhibit #209.  The exhibit is admitted into evidence by the Court. Attorney Goldmann moves for admission of exhibits 198 and 199.   Exhibits #198 and #199 are admitted for evidence by the Court.   Attorney Goldmann moves for admission of exhibits #153 and #154. The Court admits Exhibits #153 and #154 into evidence.   Attorney Goldmann moves for admission of exhibits 155, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161 and 170.  The Court admits the exhibits155, 157, 158, 159, 160, 161 and 170 into evidence.  The photos are published to the jurors.  Attorney Goldmann moves for admission of exhibits 205, 206 and 207.  The Court admits the documents into evidence.  Exhibits 205, 206 and 207 are published to the jurors.    Exhibit #194, #195 #196,#197,are moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  The photos are published to the jurors.   Exhibits #201 and #208 moved and admitted. The Photos are published to the jurors.  Exhibits #202 and #204 are moved to and admitted into evidence.  Exhibit #193 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Exhibit 151 is published to the jurors. Attorney Hulgaard cross-examines the witness.  Attorney Exner conducts re-direct of the witness.  The witness is excused subject to recall.  The jurors are excused at 12:17 p.m. and are to return 1:45 p.m.   The Court addresses a few house keeping issues.  The parties are excused at 12:20 p.m. and are to return at 1:30 p.m.  The case is recalled at 1:30 p.m.  The parties address house keeping issues.  Defendant Kevin Lipscomb is sworn in and the Court performs plea colloquy.  The Defendant advises the Court he will not testify.  Attorney Goldmann moves for Exhibit of 177, the Court admits #177 into evidence.  The jurors enter the Court room at 2:00 p.m.  The State calls Rebuttal Witness Mark C. Corporate Security Officer with Quad Graphics.  The witness is sworn and Attorney Hulgaard conducts direct examination of the witness.  The State moves for admission of Exhibit #135.   The Court admits #135 into evidence.  Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination of the witness.  The witness is excused.  The State calls rebuttal witness Christopher T. with Auto Scrap Recyclers.  The witness is sworn in by the clerk and the State conducts direct examination of the witness.    Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination of the witness.  Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination of the witness.  Re-direct by Attorney Hulgard.  Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann.  The witness is excused.  The State calls rebuttal witness Detective Vito Sorce.  Attorney Hulgaard conducts direct examination.  Attorney Hulgaard requests admission of Exhibits #136 and #137.  The Court admits the #136 and #137 into evidence. Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination of the witness.  Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination of the witness.   Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard.  The State calls rebuttal witness Robert Bechtold with the Department of Criminal Investigation.  The State moves for admission of Exhibit #136.  Exhibit #136 is admitted into evidence by the Court. Attorney Goldmaan and Attorney Exner conduct cross-examination of the witness. Re-direct by the Attorney Hulgaard.    The witness is excused.  The jurors are excused at 3:00 p.m. for a break until 3:15 p.m. and the Court conducts house keeping issues outside the presence of the jurors.  The Court recalls the case at 3:15 p.m. outside the presence of the jurors to discuss jury instructions.    The jurors reenter the court room and Detective Sorce is recalled and testifies.  The witness is excused.  The State rests.   The Court reads jury instructions.  Attorney Hulgaard presents closing arguments.  Attorney Exner presents closing arguments.  Attorney Goldmann presents closing arguments.  Attorney Hulgaard presents final rebuttal argument.  The Court announces the two alternate jurors and they are excused.  The clerk swears in the civilian bailiff.  Jurors retire to the jury room for deliberation at 5:05 p.m.  The Court recalls the case with the same appearances outside the presence of the jurors at 6:03 p.m.  The Court addresses the evidence requested from the jurors.  The jurors were provided with all the paper admitted exhibits. The jurors enter the court room at 6:12 p.m. The Court address the jurors regarding the evidence requested.  The jurors are excused at 6:15 p.m. and are to return tomorrow morning to continue deliberation at 8:30 a.m. in the jury room.   The parties are excused at 6:16 p.m. and are to be available tomorrow by telephone.

Signed by Judge Aprahamian on 2/15/16.  It is ordered that Mr. Lipscomb's motion to exclude evidence relating to recorded telephonic conversations made from the Waukesha County Jail while in custody in this matter is granted.  None of the statements will be admitted on direct or cross-examination, unless directly contrary to the defendant's testimony on direct examination.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Andria Noel in Court with Attorney Exner.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DAY 5 OF TRIAL.  The Court calls the case to address the issue of jail recordings.  Attorney Hulgaard and  Attorney Goldmann are sworn in by the clerk.   The Court questions the Attorney Hulgaard, Attorney Goldmann and Officer Brian Walter.  The Court will take the matter under advisement.  The Court will also take under advisement the matter of timely discovery provided by the State to the Defense.  The jurors enter the courtroom  The State recalls Detective Brian Walter to the stand.  The State continues direct examination of the witness. Exhibits 120A, 120B, 120C, 120D ,120E and 121A are moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.   The witness is cross-examined by Attorney Goldmann. The jurors are excused and the Court addresses housekeeping issues and the Court requests additional information regarding jail phone calls. The Court takes a short break and will reconvene at 11:00.  The Court reconvenes at 11:10 a.m. outside the presence of the jurors.  The Court renders a decision regarding disclosure of discovery. Exhibits #167, 190 and 192 are moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.   The witness is cross-examined by the Attorney Exner.  Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard. Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann. Re-cross by Attorney Exner.  Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard. The jurors are excused at 12:05 and are to return at 1:30.  The parties are excused at 12:08 p.m. and are to return at 1:20 p.m.  The Court recalls the case at 1:28 p.m.  The Defendant Andria Noel is sworn in and the Court performs plea colloquy.  The Defendant advises the Court that she plans to testify.  The witness is excused.  The State recalls witness Lt. Gabor.  The State conducts direct examination of the witness.  Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination.  The State recalls witness Vito Sorce.  The State performs direct examination of the witness. The State moves for admission of Exhibits 107 and 108.  The Court moves the exhibits into evidence. Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination of the witness. Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination of the witness.  Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard.  Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann Exhibit #205 moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  The witness is excused.  The State rests.  Attorney Exner calls his first witness Defendant Andria Noel.  The Witness is sworn in and Attorney Exner conducts direct examination.  Attorney Exhibitit moves and the Court admits Exhibit #251 into evidence.  Attorney Exner conducts direct examination of the witness.   Attorney Exner moves for admission of exhibit 218 and the exhibit is admitted into evidence by the Court.  Attorney Hulgaard performs cross-examination of the witness.  Re-direct by Attorney Exner and Attorney Goldmann.  Attorney Exner would like to call S.S. as a character witness on behalf of the Defendant Andria Noel. The jurors are excused and the Court addresses the request outside the presence of the jurors.   The Court takes a break and the parties are to be return to the Court room at 3:33 p.m.  The Court will allow S.S. to testify as a character witness.  Attorney Exner calls S.S. to testify.  The witness is sworn in and testifies on behalf of the Defendant.  The Witness is excused.  Attorney Exner rests.  Attorney Goldman calls Private Investigator Karen Checki.  The witness is sworn in and testifies and Attorney Goldmann performs direct examination.  Attorney Hulgaard conducts cross-examination.    Re-direct by Attorney Goldmann.  Re-cross by Attorney Hulgaard.  The jurors are excused at 4:25 p.m. and are to return at 9:30 a.m. tomorrow morning.  The court addresses house keeping issues outside the presence of the jurors.  The State moves for admittance of exhibits 134 and 221 and admitted into evidence by the Court.   The witness is excused.  The court addresses proposed jury instructions.  The parties are excused at 4:50 p.m.  The parties to to return at 9:00 a.m. tomorrow morning.
Signed by the parties and Judge Aprahamain on 2/12/16 stipulating there were two cell phones recovered from Kevin Lipscomb at the time of his arrest on February 13, 2015.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Andria D. Noel in court with attorney Daniel Exner.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JURY TRIAL DAY 4.  The parties discuss housekeeping matter including marking of additional exhibits off the record.  The Court calls the case on the record at 8:55 a.m. Exhibits #122, 123, 124, 126 and 127 are marked, offered and admitted by stipulation.  The jurors enter the courtroom at 8:55 a.m.  The State calls its witness Officer Jason Cychosz with the Menomonee Falls Police Department.  The witness is sworn in and direct examination is conducted by the State.  Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination. Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination.  Re-direct of the witness by the State.  Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann.  The witness is excused.  The State calls witness Detective Nicholas Welch with the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.  The witness is sworn in and the State conducts Direct Examination of the witness.  Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination of the witness.   Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination of the witness.  Redirect by the State. Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann. Re-cross by the State. The witness is excused. The jurors are excused at 10:12 for a short break and Court will reconvene at 10:25 a.m.The Court reconvenese at 10:28 a.m. The jurors reenter the court room.  The State calls witness Nicole Hinton, Senior DNA Lab Analyst with the State Crime Lab of Milwaukee.   The witness is sworn in and direct examination is conducted by the State.    Exhibit #174 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Cross-examination conducted by Attorney Goldmann.   Cross Examination by Attorney Exner.  Re-direct by the State.  The witness is excused but is subject to recall. The Court takes break for lunch at 11:26 and is to return at 1:00 for continuation of testimony. The jurors are excused from the court room.   The Court recalls the case at 1:00 p.m. and the Court covers a few housekeeping issues.  The jurors enter the courtroom at 1:03 p.m.  The State calls witness Detective Shari Janke Detective of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department is sworn in and the State conducts direct examination.  The Court reads a stipulation and order signed by the parties regarding the cell phones recovered from Defendant Lipscomb.   The State continues with direct examination.  Attorney Goldmann conducts cross-examination. The witness is excused.   The State calls Criminal Analyst Robert Bechtold with the Department of Justice.  The witness is sworn in by the clerk and the State conducts direct-examation of the witness.  Page 3 of exhibit 128 is published to the jury. The jurors are excused and the parties discuss exhibits being admitted.  The Court takes a brief break.  The case is recalled and the jurors enter the courtroom.  Direct examination of the witness continues.  Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination. Attorney Goldmann condcuts cross-examination of the witness.  Attorney Hulgaard conducts re-direct of the witness.  The witness is excused.  The jurors are excused from the court room for a short break.  The Court addresses a few housekeeping issues regarding upcoming witnesses.  The Court recalls the case and jurors enter the court room.  The State calls witness Lt. Gabor with the Waukesha County Jail.  The witness is sworn in and testifies by direct examination by the State.  Exhibit #129 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.   The witness is excused and will resume testimony after the next witness has finished testifying. The State calls witness Christine Janson with the Waukesha County Jail booking  Department.  The Witness is sworn in and testified by direct examination by the State.  Exhibits #131 and #132 are moved by the State to be entered into evidence.  The Court will take admission of the exhibits under advisement.    Cross-examination by Attorney Goldmann.  The witness is excused.  The Court recalls Lt. Gabor. 
The State calls Officer Brian Walter with the Village of Menomonee Falls Department.  The witness is sworn in and the State conducts direct examination.  The jurors are excused at 4:30 p.m. The Court conducts house keeping issues and the parties are excused.  The trial will resume Monday, February 15, 2016 at 8:15 a.m.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.   Defendant Andria D. Noel in court with Attorney Daniel Exner.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury Trial Day 3.  The Court calls the case 8:15 a.m. and discusses housekeeping issues.  Exhibits 33  through 71 are marked and stipulated to by the parties to move into evidence.  The Court admits the exhibits by stipulation.    Exhibits 73  through 98 are marked and stipulated to by the parties to move into evidence.  The Court admits the exhibits by stipulation.  Exhibits 104, 105, 106 and 110 are marked and stipulated to by the parties to move into evidence.  The Court admits the exhibits by stipulation.    The jurors enters the courtroom at 9:20 a.m.  The State calls its next witness Officer Christopher Harding with the Menomonee Falls Police Department is sworn in and the state begins direct examination.   Exhibits #27, 28, 29 and 30 are stipulated to be moved into evidence.  The Court admits the exhibits into evidence.   Attorney Goldmann objection to certain testimony the jurors are excused and the parties discuss the issue outside the presence of the jury.  The Court will allow direct examination to continue by the State. The jurors enter the courtroom and testimony continues.  Exhibit #103 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.   Cross-examination by Attorney Goldmann.  The jurors are excused for a break at 10:37 a.m.  The Court conducts a few housekeeping issues and takes a brief break. The jurors re-enter the courtroom at 10:50 a.m. Attorney Goldmann continues with cross-examination.  Cross-examination by Attorney Exner.  Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard. Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann. Re-cross by Attorney Exner.  The witness is excused.  The State calls its next witness Officer Vito Sorce with the Menomonee Falls Police Department.  The witness is sworn in and testifies by Direct Examination by the State. The jurors are excused and the court recessess for lunch at 12:00.  All parties are excused and are to return to the Courtroom at 1:30 to resume testimony.  The case is recalled and the jurors enter the courtroom at 1:30 p.m.  Direct Examination continues of the witness.  The parties take a side bar outside the presence of the courtroom.  Attorney Goldmann cross-examines the witness.  Exhitib #152, #176, #184 and #185 are offered and admitted into evidence by the Court.  The Court takes a short break.  The Court recalls the case and exhibits #99, #100 and #101 are stipulated to by the parties and admitted by the Court.  The jurors re-enter the Courtroom.  Cross-examination continues by Attorney Goldmann. Exhibit #182 is moved admitted into evidence by the Court.  Attorney Exner cross-examines the witness. Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard. Attorney Goldmann conducts re-cross of the witness. Re-Direct by the State. Recross by Attorney Exner.  The State calls witness L.K. (Bank Manager Anchor Bank).  The witness is sworn in and direct examined by the State.   Ehibit #250 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Attorney Exner conducts cross-examination.    Attorney Goldman conducts cross-examination. Re-direct by the State. Re-cross by Attorney Exner.  Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann. The witness is excused.  The jurors are excused at 4:52 p.m. and are to return at 8:30 a.m. on Friday, February 12, 2016.  The Court conducts housekeeping in regards to exhibits and testimony for tomorrow.  Exhibits #113, #116 and #186 are moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  The parties are excused at 5:08 p.m. and are to return tomorrow morning at 8:00 a.m. for continuation of housekeeping issues regarding exhibits.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Andria D. Noel in Court with Attorney Daniel Exner.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DAY TWO of the jury trial.  The Court calls the case at 8:30 a.m. and the parties discuss housekeeping issues.  The attorneys discuss stipulation off the record.  The jurors enter the Courtroom at 8:45 a.m.  The State recalls witness D.K..  Attorney Goldman continues cross eximation.  Attorney Exner cross-examines the Defendant.  The State contucts re-direct of the witness.  Re-cross by Attorney Goldman.   Re-direct on the re-cross by Attorney Hulgaard.  Exhibit #5 is moved into evidence by the State.  Attorney Goldman objects to the exhibit.  The jurors are excused and the matter is discussed outside the presence of the jurors.  The Court takes a short break.  The jurors renter the courtroom at .  The Court admits Exhibit #5 into evidence.  Attorney Hulgaard continue with re-cross.  The witness is excused.  The State calls witness Barry Babler with Menomonee Falls Police Department.  The witness is sworn in and direct examination by the State.  Exhibit #12 , #13 and #14 are moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Cross-examination by Attorney Goldmann.  Exhibit #173 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Exhibit #175 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Exhibit 
#151 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  The jurors are excused at 11:58 for lunch break.  The Court break for lunch at 12:01 p.m.  The trial will resume at 1:30 p.m.  The Court recalls the case at 1:40 p.m.    Prior to the Court being called the attorneys met sidebar to cover a few housekeeping issues. Preliminary Jury Instructions/proposed verdicts supplied to the attorney's for review.  The jurors enter the courtroom at 1:44 p.m.   Attorney Goldmann continues with cross examination of Officer Barry Baler. Cross examination by Attorney Exner. Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard.  Re-cross by Attorney Goldmann.  Re-cross by Attorney Exner.  Re-direct by Attorney Hulgaard. Re-cross by Attorney Godmann. The witness is excused. The court takes a short break.  The case is recalled at 2:50 p.m.  The State calls witness Officer Dane Helland with Menomonee Falls Police Department.  The witness is sworn in.  The State conducts direct examination of the witness. Exhibit #72 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Exhibit #11 is moved and admitted into evidence by the Court.  Exhibit #15 through 26 are moved and admitted into evidence.  Attorney Goldmann cross-examines the witness.  Attorney Exner cross examines the witness.  Redirect by Attorney Hulgaard.  Witness is excused.  The jurors are excused at 4:50 p.m. and are to return tomorrow by 8:30 a.m. The Court addresses additional housekeeping issues.  The Court adjourns for the day at 5:00 p.m.   The parties are to return at 8:15 a.m. tomorrow morning.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.  Defendant Andria Noel in court with Attorney Daniel Exner. Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Exner motions the Court to sever the Defendant's for trial.  The State objects to the motion.  The Court denies the motion and the the trial will proceed as set.   The witnesses including expert will be excluded from the Court room for testimony. Attorney Goldmann objects to Court Officer Brian Walter present during the trial.  The Court does not grant the request and Court Officer Walter will allowed to be present during testimony.  The Court addresses motion in limine (housekeeping issues).  The parties are in agreement to the 2 prior convictions of the Defendant if the Defendant testifies.  The jurors will be permitted to take notes but will not be permitted to submit questions.  Court in in recess.  Court reconvenes.  Jurors enter the courtroom at 9:45 a.m.  Court presents introductory remarks.  Clerk swears panel of jurors.  Court conducts voir dire. Juror Karen H. struck for cause.  The Clerk calls next potential juror.  Juror Carol S. struck for cause. The Clerk calls next potential juror. The Court conducts a side bar in chambers outside the presence of the Court. The Court reconvenes and takes a short recess.  Court reconvenes and continues with voir dire. State conduct voir dire. Attorney Exner conducts voir dire. Attorney Goldmann conducts voir dire.  The State conducts voir dire on one juror outside the presence of the other jurors.  The State requests the juror be struck for cause.  The Court calls the next potential juror.  Attorney Exner and Attorney Goldmann do not request the juror be struck.  The Court strikes Sean M. for cause.  The Clerk calls next potential juror.  The Court conducts a side bar in chambers outside the presence of the jurors.  Attorney Goldmann conducts final voir dire.  The State conducts 5 strikes.  The Defense attorneys conduct 4 strikes each for a total of 8.  14 jurors are enpaneled which includes 2 alternates. The remaining jurors are excused to Room C108.  The Clerk swears in the selected jurors.  The Court presents preliminary instructions.  The jurors are excused at for lunch at 12:25 p.m.  The parties are excused for lunch.  The Court will reconvene at 1:30 p.m.   Court reconvenes at 1:30 p.m.  Attorney Exner requests sequestration of witnesses.  Court orders sequestration of witnesses.  All potential witnesses exit the courtroom.  All other appearances remain the same.  Jurors enter courtroom at 1:32 p.m.  Court gives preliminary instructions to the jurors.  Opening statements made by the state.  Opening statements made by Attorney Daniel Exner.  Opening statements made by Attorney James Goldmann.  Notebooks distributed to the jurors. The State calls its first witness:  D.K.  The witness is sworn in and testified on direct examination  Exhibit 1 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State.  Exhibit #2 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State.  Exhibit #4 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State.  Exhibit #3 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State. Exhibit #6 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State. Exhibit #7 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State.  Exhibit #8 is moved into evidence by the State. Exhibit #9 is moved and admitted into evidence by the State. The Court takes a short break at 3:20 and will reconvene at 3:30.   Jurors enter courtroom 3:30 p.m. Direct Examination of D.K. continues by the State. Cross Examination by Attorney James Goldmann. Exhibit #162 is moved and admitted into evidence by Attorney Goldmann.  Exhibit #169 is moved and admitted into evidence.   #150 is moved and admitted into evidence.  Exhibit #171 is moved and admitted into evidence.   The jurors are excused at 4:36 for the day and are to return tomorrow morning by 8:30 a.m.   The parties in the case are excused at 4:38 and are to return tomorrow at or around 8:15 a.m.

Defendant Kevin M Lipscomb in court, in custody, with attorney James E Goldmann.    Michele Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Defendant addresses the Court and advises the Court he is requesting a new attorney.  Attorney Goldmann addresses the Court and advises the Court that the parties are ready to proveed to trial.  The Court denies the Defendant's request for new counsel and advises the parties that the trial will proceed as scheduled.    Attorney Hulgaard advises the Court that any motion in limine will be filed with the Court in a timely matter.   Attorney Goldmann advises the Court he does not plan to file any motion in limine at this time.     The trial is expected to last 2 to 3 days.  The Court orders 2 alternates.  The Defendant will be appearing in street clothes.
